chapter.p: 1Concerning Moab, thus says Yahweh of hosts, the God of Israel:

ul.li1: “Woe to Nebo,
ul.li2: for it is devastated.
ul.li1: It is ashamed,
ul.li2: Kiriathaim is captured.
ul.li1: Misgab is ashamed,
ul.li2: and it is filled with terror.
ul.li1: 2The glory of Moab is no longer.
ul.li2: In Heshbon they planned evil against her.
ul.li1: Come and let us cut her off from being a nation.
Also, Madmen, you will be silent.
ul.li2: After you will go the sword.
ul.li1: 3The sound of a cry of distress arises from Horonaim,
ul.li2: devastation and great destruction.
ul.li1: 4Moab is broken,
ul.li2: her little ones make heardLiterally “cause to hear” a cry for help.
ul.li1: 5For the ascent of Luhith,
ul.li2: in weeping they go weeping,
ul.li1: For on the slope of Horonaim they have heard
ul.li2: the distresses of the cry of distress of the destruction.
ul.li1: 6Flee! Save your life!
ul.li2: ForLiterally “And” you must not be like the juniper tree in the desert.
ul.li1: 7For because of your trusting in your works and in your treasures,
ul.li2: even you yourselves will be taken,
ul.li1: and Chemosh will go out into the exile,
ul.li2: his priests and his officials together.
ul.li1: 8And the destroyer will come to every town,
ul.li2: and a town will not escape.
ul.li1: And the valley will be destroyed,
ul.li2: and the plain will be destroyed, as Yahweh has spoken.
ul.li1: 9Give salt for Moab,
ul.li2: for certainly she will go to ruin,
ul.li1: and her towns will become as a desolation,
ul.li2: withoutLiterally “from there is not” an inhabitant in them.
ul.li1: 10The one who does the work of Yahweh with slackness is cursed,
ul.li2: and the one who keeps away blood from his sword is cursed.
ul.li1: 11Moab has been at ease from his youth,
ul.li2: and he has been quiet on his dregs,
and he has not been poured out from vessel to vessel,
and he has not gone into exile.
ul.li1: ThereforeLiterally “Unto thus” his taste has remained unchanged,
ul.li2: and his fragrance has not changed.
ul.li1: 12ThereforeLiterally “To thus” look, days are coming,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “and I will send to him decanters,Literally “those who tilt”
and they will decant him,
and his vessels they will empty out,
and their jars they will smash.
ul.li1: 13Then Moab will be ashamed of Chemosh,
ul.li2: just as the house of Israel were ashamed of Bethel, their trust.
ul.li1: 14How can you say, ‘we are warriors,
ul.li2: and men of might for the battle.’
ul.li1: 15Moab is destroyed,
ul.li2: and his towns have gone up,
ul.li1: and the choice of his young men have gone down to the slaughtering,”
ul.li2: declaresLiterally “a declaration of” the King, Yahweh of hosts is his name.
ul.li1: 16“The disaster of Moab is near to come,
ul.li2: and his disaster approaches very quickly.Literally “hastens greatly”
ul.li1: 17Mourn for him, all his surroundings,
ul.li2: and all those who knew his name.
ul.li1: Say, ‘How the staff of might is broken,
ul.li2: the staff of glory.’
ul.li1: 18Come down from glory and sit on the parched ground,
ul.li2: O inhabitant, daughter of Dibon,
ul.li1: for the destroyer of Moab has come up against you,
ul.li2: he has destroyed your fortifications.
ul.li1: 19Stand by the road and watch,
ul.li2: O inhabitant of Aroer.
ul.li1: Ask the man who is fleeing and the woman who is escaping,
ul.li2: say, ‘What has happened?’
ul.li1: 20Moab is ashamed,
ul.li2: for it is filled with terror.
ul.li1: Wail and cry out,
ul.li2: tell it by Arnon that Moab is devastated.

chapter.p: 21Judgment has also come to the land of the plain, to Holon, and to Jahaz, and on Mephaath, 22and on Dibon, and on Nebo, and on Beth-diblathaim, 23and on Kiriathaim, and on Beth-gamul, and on Beth-meon, 24and on Kerioth, and on Bozrah, and on all the towns of the land of Moab, the far and the near. 25The horn of Moab is cut off and his arm is broken,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.

ul.li1: 26“Make him drunk,
ul.li2: because he magnified himself against Yahweh,
ul.li1: and let Moab wallow in his vomit.
ul.li2: And he also will become a laughingstock.
ul.li1: 27Now was not Israel the laughingstock to you?
ul.li2: Or was he found among thieves?
ul.li1: For as often asLiterally “from enough” you spoke over him
ul.li2: you shook your head.
ul.li1: 28Leave the towns and dwell on the rock,
ul.li2: O inhabitants of Moab,
ul.li1: and be like the dove,
ul.li2: it nests on the sides of the mouth of a ravine.
ul.li1: 29We have heard of the pride of Moab
ul.li2: —he is very proud—
ul.li1: his height, and his pride, and his arrogance,
ul.li2: and the haughtiness of his heart.
ul.li1: 30I know his insolence,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “and his boastings are false;Literally “not right”
they act falsely.Literally “not right”
ul.li1: 31ThereforeLiterally “Unto thus” over Moab I wail,
ul.li2: and for all of Moab I cry out,
for the peopleOr “men” of Kir-heres I moan.
ul.li1: 32More than the weeping of Jazer
ul.li2: I weep for you, O vine Sibmah.
ul.li1: Your branches cross over the sea,
ul.li2: up to the sea of Jazer they reach.
ul.li1: Upon your summer fruit and upon your vintage
ul.li2: the destroyer has fallen.
ul.li1: 33And joy and rejoicing have been taken away from the fruitful land,
ul.li2: even from the land of Moab.
ul.li1: And the wine from the wine presses
ul.li2: I have caused to disappear.
ul.li1: He will not tread with exuberant shouts.Hebrew “exuberant shout”
ul.li2: Exuberant shoutsHebrew “Exuberant shout” will not be exuberant shouts.Hebrew “exuberant shout”
ul.li1: 34From the cry for help of Heshbon, up to Elealeh,
ul.li2: up to Jahaz, they give their voice,
ul.li1: from Zoar up to Horonaim, up to Eglath-shelishiyah,
ul.li2: for even the waters of Nimrim have become as a desolation.
ul.li1: 35And I will cause to disappear for Moab,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh,
ul.li2: “the one who presents a sacrifice at a high place,
and the one who burns a smoke offering to his gods.
ul.li1: 36ThereforeLiterally “Unto thus” my heart moans for Moab like the flute.Hebrew “flutes”
ul.li2: It moans for the peopleOr “men” of Kir-heres like the flute.Hebrew “flutes”
ThereforeLiterally “Unto thus” the wealth they gained has perished.
ul.li1: 37For on every head is baldness,
ul.li2: and every beard is trimmed.
ul.li1: On all the hands, slashes,
ul.li2: and on the loins, sackcloth.
ul.li1: 38On all the roofs of Moab, and in its public squares,
ul.li2: there is wailing everywhere.
ul.li1: For I have broken Moab like a vessel,
ul.li2: there is no delight in it,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 39“How it is filled with terror! How they wail!
ul.li2: How Moab has turned his back! He is disgraced!
ul.li1: So Moab has become as a derision,
ul.li2: and as a terror for all his surrounding peoples.”

ul.li1: “Look, like an eagle he will swoop down,
ul.li2: and he will spread out his wings against Moab.
ul.li1: 41Kerioth will be taken,
ul.li2: and the strongholds will be conquered,
ul.li1: and the heartsHebrew “heart” of the warriors of Moab will be on that day
ul.li2: like the heart of a woman who is in labor.
ul.li1: 42And Moab will be destroyed from being a people,
ul.li2: because against Yahweh he magnified himself.
ul.li1: 43Dread, and pit, and a trapping net are against you,
ul.li2: O inhabitant of Moab,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 44“He who flees beforeLiterally “from the face of” the dread
ul.li2: will fall into the pit,
ul.li1: and the one who climbs up from the pit
ul.li2: will be caught in the trapping net,
ul.li1: for I will bring on Moab
ul.li2: the year of their punishment,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.
ul.li1: 45“In the shadow of Heshbon
ul.li2: fugitives stand without strength,
ul.li1: for a fire has gone out from Heshbon,
ul.li2: and a flame from Sihon.
ul.li1: And it has eaten the forehead of Moab,
ul.li2: and the skullsHebrew “skull” of the peopleOr “sons” of tumult.
ul.li1: 46Woe to you, Moab!
ul.li2: The people of Chemosh have perished.
ul.li1: For your sons have been taken into captivity,
ul.li2: and your daughters into captivity.
ul.li1: 47Yet I will restore the fortunesHebrew “fortune” of Moab
ul.li2: in the last of the days,” declaresLiterally “a declaration of” Yahweh.

chapter.p: Thus farLiterally “Up to here” is the judgment of Moab.
